intro: Synandra hispidula, commonly known as the hairy synandra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive appearance. Synandra hispidula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
